ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs
ygData.msgSnippet: Still I think the way they were treated was insulting, and losing their guide status for one very minor infraction was overkill. All in all I d say the good
ygData.messageBody:
Still I think the way they were treated was insulting, and losing their
guide status for one very minor infraction was overkill.

All in all I'd say the good Gm/Guide encounters I've had outweigh the bad
ones about 3 to 1, but its the bad ones you really remember. I'll never
forget having a guide insult me, and not receiving an apology, or even
acknowledgement of the issue just rubbed salt into the wounds. They can't
even claim I faked logfiles or something, since I /reported him. Of course
I'm sure they can erase those.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 2:37 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs


Actually only one of the guides was perm-banned, the others were only
temporary till their Guide accounts were purged. Gordon cleared that up in
a follow up post. Apparently the one that was perm-banned had several
warnings for past problems.

Personally I have had great relations with GMs/Guides. The only one I ever
had trouble with was GM-Jagar. I sure wish GM-Mennix would come back to
Karana though :( Our current GM (DeSani) is kind of a nut though. He keeps
showing at after we kill big targets. On out last Inny kill he paid us a
visit as first Inny, then Draco, then we turned into a 6 inch tall human
lol.

Rokenn


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 1:25 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs
>
>
> I've had both sides of the coin. Gm's who were helpful and quick, and
> others who never answered (after 3 hrs I was forced to give
> up) and even
> insulting ones. There's an interesting thread on this on
> EQVault right now
> concerning the guides who were banned. Basically I'd say
> Verant's reaction
> was idiotic, childish, and insulting. The guides should have gotten a
> warning, not banned for a one liner in a 20 page document
> that none of them
> ever really noticed.
>
> Kitasi
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 2:13 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs
>
>
> I've been quite lucky. I've never had problems getting GMs to answer
> my petition/satisfy my problems.
>
> Maybe I have an honest face?
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> >Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 12:59 PM
>
> >That's what I thought too, but apparently the teleport spot for
> >Butcherblock
> >is at about 10,000 ft. You immediately fall and take 10,000
> points anyhow
> >which is as you can guess instantly fatal. Not good when
> you are bound in
> >Halas at the time as I was. The GM's never responded to my
> petition even
> >though I was beneath the world and was supposedly teleported
> to a "safe
> >spot"
> >
> > Kit
>
>
